item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The world is indeed full of peril, and in it there are many dark places; but still there is much that is fair, and though in all lands love is now mingled with grief, it grows perhaps the greater." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "For like a shaft, clear and cold, the thought pierced him that in the end the Shadow was only a small and passing thing: there was light and high beauty for ever beyond its reach." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Still round the corner there may wait A new road or a secret gate And though I oft have passed them by A day will come at last when I Shall take the hidden paths that run West of the Moon, East of the Sun." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It does not do to leave a live dragon out of your calculations, if you live near him." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Fairy tale does not deny the existence of sorrow and failure: the possibility of these is necessary to the joy of deliverance. It denies (in the face of much evidence, if you will) universal final defeat...giving a fleeting glimpse of Joy; Joy beyond the walls of the world, poignant as grief." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Farewell, and may the blessing of Elves and Men and all Free Folk go with you. May the stars shine upon your faces!" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "You can only come to the morning through the shadows." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Gandalf! I thought you were dead! But then I thought I was dead myself. Is everything sad going to come untrue? What's happened to the world?" A great Shadow has departed," said Gandalf, and then he laughed and the sound was like music, or like water in a parched land; and as he listened the thought came to Sam that he had not heard laughter, the pure sound of merriment, for days upon days without count." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "towards danger; but not too rashly, nor too straight" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Rachel add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Anything that just costs money is cheap." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rachel add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "And this I believe: that the free, exploring mind of the individual human is the most valuable thing in the world. And this I would fight for: the freedom of the mind to take any direction it wishes, undirected. And this I must fight against: any idea, religion, or government which limits or destroys the individual. This is what I am and what I am about." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rachel add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "An unbelieved truth can hurt a man much more than a lie. It takes great courage to back truth unacceptable to our times. There's a punishment for it, and it's usually crucifixion." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rachel add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "You can only understand people if you feel them in yourself." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rachel add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "There's more beauty in truth, even if it is dreadful beauty." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rachel add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "All great and precious things are lonely." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lao Tsu
item.description: "Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know." -- Lao Tsu

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "Smoking I find the most ridiculous of all the varieties of human behavior and practically the only one that is entirely against nature. Can you imagine a cow or any animal taking a mouthful of smoldering straw then breathing in the smoke and blowing it out through its nostrils?" -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "Surround yourself with human beings, my dear James. They are easier to fight for than principles." -- Ian Fleming
